website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's Fire HDX 8.9" is the best value tablet for media out there, but its ecosystem doesn't match up to other operating systems for general-purpose use.
cons: Limited storage in the initial configuration

customer_reviews.title: Not an improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 8.9" HDX. I loved my old one and definitely prefer it to this new version. My main problem is the fact that the Home, and Back buttons have for some baffling reason been moved to the middle of the bottom of the screen. This means that it is no longer possible to hold the Kindle with one hand and use one's thumb to operate the buttons - particularly annoying when reading a book. The battery runs down faster than my old Kindle - despite shutting down Wifi and always turning off the power. The screen is less sensitive - often cannot make it work with finger pressure alone.
customer_reviews.author: Bridge1

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am not a technical person when it comes to understanding computers etc. (I'm well over 70 years old), so when my wife persuaded me to buy one, I was a little worried that I might not understand how it worked. Well after 10 days of owning my NEW BEST Friend, it's fantastic and very easy it is to use. I wont be using it for games etc. but now I can sit down and enjoy all the programs I've missed on the TV. all in all, I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: roy g

customer_reviews.title: Pity.
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 would be better but there is no middle point so 2 stars it is simply because I cannot receive WiFi in my back garden on this. The signal dies at back door and fades greatly throughout the house from room to room. My 1st Generation Fire works fine outside tho its now very slow in all apps. I fear I have to return this Fire HDX! Pity because I like much of it and the sound does my music justice for this being just a Tablet.
